title: Belichick: Heels 'better than what we were tonight'

content: An FIR was lodged on September 1 at Rasra Police Station on the complaint of Dilip Kumar Gupta, a trader from Gudri Bazar in Rasra town

content: The 1.43-acre project offers a development potential of 0.7 million square feet, providing new, premium homes for existing residents while also creating a substantial portion for sale

content: Senior advocate A.M. Singhvi told the court that a Governor is at best a ‚Äúlubricator‚Äù, a ‚Äúfacilitator‚Äù, but not a legislator

title: Justice B.V. Nagarathna: A dissent to safeguard the future
content: The dissent from the lone woman Supreme Court judge on the elevation of Justice Pancholi is multi-faceted. It did not merely focus on the point that there were other senior women High Court judges. Her reservations touched upon the criteria the Collegium had to consider while assessing a candidate for elevation

title: Farmers seek more compensation for crop damage by wild animals in Dharwad district of Karnataka
content: Labour minister and district-in-charge minister for Dharwad on Monday spent the entire day visiting affected villages in his constituency (Kalaghatagi) where crops have been damaged by wild animals and held ‚ÄòJana Spandana‚Äô grievances redressal meeting in Kalaghatagi town.

title: Mahesh Goud says Kavitha admitted corruption in Kaleshwaram
content: ‚ÄúWhy are BRS leaders, who claim they have done no wrong, so afraid of a CBI probe? If they are innocent, they should face the investigation,‚Äù Mahesh Goud said

title: BJP seeks re-investigation into Soujanya rape-murder case in Dharmasthala
content: Karnataka High Court said in 2024 that no purpose will be served even if reinvestigation is permitted into the case

content: Madhya Pradesh CM Mohan Yadav launches Vedic clock and app merging Hindu calendar with modern technology, emphasising Indian heritage

content: The Minister urged the Panchayat representatives to dedicate some time for the organisational activities of the BJP alongside their regular work

content: The Indian contingent, comprising troops from a battalion of the Madras Regiment, will train alongside soldiers of the 1st Battalion, 5th Infantry Regiment ‚ÄúBobcats‚Äù, part of the Arctic Wolves Brigade Combat Team of the U.S. Army‚Äôs 11th Airborne Division

title: Heavy rain lashes parts of Bhadradri Kothagudem district; 16 gates of Taliperu reservoir lifted
content: According to sources, a low-level causeway near Vagoddugudem village was flooded, cutting off road links to more than a dozen villages for several hours.

title: Rajasthan Assembly‚Äôs Monsoon Session starts with uproarious scenes
content: As soon as the House assembled, the Congress members started shouting slogans and displayed placards against vote theft allegations

title: J&K‚Äôs Kishtwar highly vulnerable to glacial lake bursts: report
content: Key public infrastructure including roads, schools and government buildings were at risk, the report highlighted; the district has the highest number of glacial lakes in the Union Territory.¬†

title: Govt. launches ‚ÄòAdi Vaani‚Äô to translate Adivasi languages
content: The government said that while the app is currently equipped to translate four languages ‚Äì Gondi, Bhili, Mundari and Santali

title: Over 3 lakh acres of land hit by flood in Haryana; Faridabad on edge after release of excess water in Yamuna
content: Over 46,880 farmers in 1,003 villages have registered on the e-Kshatipurti portal for crop damage claims

title: Kochi sees significant surge in NDPS cases, seizures
content: Over 300 kg of ganja, nearly 3 kg of MDMA seized in eight months; drugs flow into city in large quantities

title: School in Kochi revises rules, to fine parents for late arrival of students
content: According to the revised rules, a child will no longer be punished or miss classes for arriving late. Instead, the onus has been placed on parents, who may now face a fine for bringing their wards late to schoo

title: ‚ÄòMillennium City‚Äô ramps up civic response after outcry over crippling infrastructure
content: A two-day rain-induced deluge in July sparked public fury in Gurugram, prompting the city‚Äôs municipal corporation to launch a drive targeting waterlogging, waste management, and other civic issues

title: Immigration bureau set to check fraud, deport foreigners
content: The Rules to govern the Immigration and Foreigners Act, 2025, notified by the MHA on Monday (September 1, 2025), allow for recording biometric data of foreigners and mandate educational institutions to inform the BOI about foreign students. Clubs and resorts can be shut down if frequented by illegal migrants or foreigners with criminal record

title: Despite vacancies in government medical college hospitals in T.N., forensic doctors work at primary health centres
content: According to the doctors, over 70 posts of assistant professors and senior residents in forensic medicine remain vacant. Even after 20 in-service doctors joining after October, many posts will remain unfilled, they add

title: Train fare hike: a case of too little, too late
content: Railways needs big money for modernisation and progress; a fare increase was long overdue, but the tiny increase effective July 1 may not be the solution

title: Congress MP Sasikanth Senthil withdraws hunger strike temporarily
content: Congress top brass appealed to give up the hunger strike, Mr. Senthil says; he was protesting against the Centre over Samagra Shiksha Abhiyan funds for Tamil Nadu

title: Incessant rain and flood disrupt life in northern India
content: Punjab Governor to visit flood-affected districts from tomorrow; entire Himachal State declared as disaster hit; heavy rainfall warning issued for Haryana; precautionary measures ramped up in Chandigarh

title: Will accept Bihar SIR claims until last date of nominations: Election Commission of India
content: Earlier in the day in Supreme Court, the poll panel submitted it would accept revision forms even after the deadline, and these would be integrated into the final list

title: Amit Shah takes stock of rain-inflicted damage in Jammu and Kashmir, promises help
content: Home Minister calls for strengthening early warning systems to reduce the impact of natural calamities; teams from Ministry of Home Affairs and union territory administration should prioritise damage assessment and a meeting of relevant departments will be held soon, he says

title: DMK govt. trying to save Madurai Mayor in property tax scam, says Palaniswami
content: The AIADMK general secretary says without the Mayor‚Äôs instruction, the irregularities in the Corporation could not have happened

content: ‚ÄúWe can‚Äôt say that law and order has collapsed. Within half an hour, police cleared the roads,‚Äù Chief Minister Devenra Fadnavis said.

title: New orchid recorded in Arunachal Pradesh
content: The Gastrochilus pechei has underlined the floral link between the State and Myanmar, the researchers said

title: Uttarakhand reserves 10% jobs for retired Agniveers in uniformed posts
content: The Cabinet had approved the proposal for reservation for Agniveers in State government jobs last month

title: Prime suspect in murder of 18-year-old arrested in Uttar Pradesh
content: Ishita Mallick was shot in her home in front of her family on the afternoon of August 25. While the details of the motive and the nature of the crime are still pending interrogation, the police said that a relationship feud may have been one of the possible motives

title: Nagaland University to develop grammar for 18 Naga languages
content: Naga tongues have been taught in schools for decades, but none have a dedicated written grammar for the teaching-learning process

title: Supreme Court seeks response to transgender-inclusive sex education plea
content: The petition seeks the formal integration of age-appropriate, transgender-inclusive comprehensive sexuality education (CSE) into school curricula nationwide

title: Supreme Court issues notice to Centre after T.N. says Samagra Shiksha funds delinked from RTE reimbursements
content: Tamil Nadu submitted that the Centre and State had concurrent responsibility to fund the education of poor and disadvantaged children under Section 7 of the RTE Act, 2009

title: Can minority-run schools be exempted from RTE law, SC refers question to larger Bench
content: A Constitution Bench, in 2014, held that the RTE law violated the minority character of these institutions and took the institutions entirely out of the ambit of the law. On Monday, Justice Datta observed that the 2014 judgment has ‚Äòunknowingly jeopardised the very foundation of universal elementary education‚Äô

title: Congress resolves to ensure Mamkootathil‚Äôs attendance as an ‚Äòunattached member‚Äô in Kerala Assembly
content: DYFI State president V.K. Sanoj reaffirms the Left youth organisation‚Äôs determination to deter  Mamkootathil from attending the House

title: CM inaugurates projects worth over ‚Çπ180 crore at Thiruvananthapuram MCH
content: Pinarayi Vijayan flags the recent trend of corporate takeover of private hospitals as it leads to significant escalation in treatment costs.

title: Report on access of public toilets for women in Kolkata reveals huge gaps in availability, safety and cleanliness
content: The report, which was based on a large-scale survey of over 7,616 respondents, has been put together by Kolkata-based Sabar Institute, the Azad Foundation and volunteers from eight colleges and two universities. Among the women who participated in the survey, 43% were street vendors, 13.8 % were domestic workers and 15.7% were retail salespersons. 38 trans persons were interviewed during the survey

title: There‚Äôs no problem if Muslims accept Indian culture, laws: Assam CM
content: On the sidelines of an official event in southern Assam‚Äôs Sribhumi, Himanta Biswa Sarma said people living in Barak Valley listening to Bangladesh radio channels was unacceptable

title: Phones fall silent, fears rise as Afghans in Delhi await news from quake-hit homeland
content: At least 812 people were killed and over 2,500 injured when the 6.0 magnitude quake struck towns in Kunar province in Nangarhar; the tragedy has left many Afghans here consumed with fear about the fate of their loved ones.

title: Two workers killed, 20 injured as blast triggers fire at textile unit in Gujarat
content: The incident occurred at Santosh Textile Mill in Jolva village in the afternoon after a chemical drum exploded

title: Crime Branch records statement of third-party complainant in probe against Rahul Mamkootathil
content: The complainant, Lawyer Shinto Sebastian, who had, quoting an anonymous voice clip, accused the Palakkad MLS of ‚Äúcoercing a victim‚Äù to terminate her pregnancy at the peril of her life, says he has submitted the ‚Äúevidence‚Äù to investigators

title: E-tailer Meesho to create 12 lakh seasonal jobs this festive season
content: Meesho claims that sellers have hired 5.5 lakh seasonal workers as part of their requirements for the festive season while logistics partnerships have helped generate 6.7 lakh seasonal job opportunities

title: 11-member committee to investigate elephant deaths
content: Repeated instances of elephant carcasses being found in a river in the Malayattoor Forest Division spark demand for investigation

title: Tulu, Yakshagana theatres, ‚ÄòDaivaradhane‚Äô stakeholders Janagraha convention likely in Mangaluru on September 9
content: They oppose government authorities not allowing cultural events to run beyond 10 p.m. in DK, Udupi districts

title: Andhra Pradesh launches Swachha Andhra Awards, first State to honour excellence in cleanliness
content: Andhra Pradesh will present annual awards at State and district levels to recognise excellence in sanitation across institutions, communities, and individuals, with the first ceremony scheduled for October 2, 2025, on Mahatma Gandhi‚Äôs birth anniversary, says official

title: HC restrains police from arresting bodybuilder till Sept. 12
content: As per the FIR, the bodybuilder allegedly trespassed into the gym, which he had leased out to a woman, and stole over ‚Çπ10,000 and some documents

title: KTR says CBI probe on Kaleshwaram Barrages is conspiracy against Telangana
content: He alleges that it‚Äôs a plot hatched by Revanth Reddy, Naidu, Modi; Party calls for protests across the State

title: Rape case: AAP MLA Harmeet Singh Pathanmajra arrested; flees after firing at police
content: Aam Aadmi Party MLA Harmeet Singh Pathanmajra was arrested by Patiala police in connection with a rape case, sparking political turmoil. Pathanmajra claims the arrest is retaliation for criticizing the party's Delhi leadership, alleging they are undermining Punjab leaders and ignoring local issues. He urged supporters to protest, accusing the Delhi leadership of remote-controlling Punjab and punishing dissent.

title: Despite 'economic selfishness': PM Modi hails India's 7.8% GDP growth; takes veiled dig at Trump
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi highlighted India's impressive 7.8% GDP growth, achieved amidst global economic concerns fueled by what he termed "economic selfishness," a likely reference to US trade policies. This statement comes after the US imposed significant tariffs on Indian exports and targeted India's Russian oil purchases, escalating trade tensions between the two nations.

title: 'Put it in container': Pak defence minister‚Äôs solution for floods; calls excess water 'blessing'
content: Pakistan's defence minister Khawaja Asif suggested citizens store floodwater as a blessing amid severe flooding in Punjab province, which has claimed 33 lives and displaced over 700,000 residents. Punjab is experiencing its biggest flood in history, impacting two million people and threatening food security due to crop damage. Monsoon rains have been excessive, leading to widespread devastation across the country.

title: 'Shame': Trump trade adviser's fresh attack on India after RIC huddle at SCO; takes jibe at PM Modi
content: Peter Navarro criticized PM Modi for aligning with Putin and Xi Jinping at the SCO summit, urging India to support Europe and Ukraine and cease purchasing Russian oil. He accused India of "profiteering" from refined Russian oil sales and labeled the conflict as "Modi's war." The US has imposed tariffs on India, which New Delhi deems "unjustified."

title: ‚ÄòIf you arrest us ...': Jarange warns Fadnavis govt; vows to stay till demands met
content: Maratha quota activist Manoj Jarange has warned of intensified protests in Mumbai, with more Marathas expected to arrive over the weekend. Jarange cautioned authorities against arrests or lathi charges, threatening severe consequences. Mumbai Police rejected a renewed request for agitation at Azad Maidan, citing violations and court directives.

title: Accenture CEO breaks tradition: No memo for restructuring; Here‚Äôs what she did
content: Accenture CEO Julie Sweet announced a major organizational restructuring via video message, breaking corporate tradition to connect emotionally with the 770,000-person workforce across 120 countries. Driven by client needs and a strategy to become the "reinvention partner of choice," the transformation aims to integrate previously siloed business units for comprehensive digital solutions.

title: 'Designed & made in India': PM Modi on chip mission at Semicon 2025 - top quotes
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated Semicon India 2025, emphasizing India's ambition to become a semiconductor hub. He received the first made-in-India Vikram 32-bit processor and highlighted the nation's commitment through reforms and investments. Modi envisions India as a key player, designing, manufacturing, and exporting trusted semiconductors globally, driving significant change and economic growth.

title: 'Proposed visit of a VVIP': Is PM Modi heading to violence-hit Manipur on Sept 13? What we know
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is likely to visit Mizoram and Manipur on September 13, as officials said, marking his first visit to Manipur since ethnic tensions escalated in May 2023. In Mizoram, he is expected to inaugurate a railway line connecting Aizawl with Silchar, Assam, as part of the Act East Policy.

title: Jitesh Sharma Exclusive: A small-town boy, who keeps and is blooming in the finisher's role
content: Jitesh Sharma scored only 261 runs in Royal Challengers Bengaluru's (RCB) title-winning season, but it was not the runs that caught the selectors‚Äô eyes, it was his 176.35 strike rate while batting at 6 and 7. Jitesh, who never had a coach, learnt cricket by watching YouTube videos of his childhood heroes Adam Gilchrist and Sourav Ganguly. Making a comeback into the Indian team at the age of 31 is as breathtaking as his cricketing sojourn.

title: Apple & Samsung to Xiaomi: Stop using our phones; 'Cease and Desist' notice sent
content: Apple and Samsung have reportedly taken legal action against Xiaomi in India over advertisements that allegedly disparaged their products. The ads compared Xiaomi phones and TVs to those of Apple and Samsung, questioning their value and technology.

title: Vote 'chori' row: BJP steps up attack on Congress; claims Pawan Khera has 2 voter ID cards
content: The BJP has accused Congress leader Pawan Khera of possessing two voter ID cards, prompting calls for an Election Commission investigation into potential electoral law violations. This accusation coincides with Rahul Gandhi's intensified criticism of the government, alleging "vote theft" during the recent "Voter Adhikar Yatra" in Bihar.

title: 'Threw India ties aside for Pak business': Ex-US NSA blasts Trump; calls it a 'huge strategic harm'
content: Former NSA Jake Sullivan accuses Donald Trump of prioritizing his family's business interests in Pakistan over strengthening ties with India, calling it a strategic blunder. Sullivan suggests Trump's actions, including potential Bitcoin deals and trade agreements with Pakistan, undermine US credibility and worry allies. He highlights the importance of a strong US-India relationship to counter China.

title: Meta's AI shake-up: Chaos at company; Tie-up with Scale AI may be facing strain
content: Meta's $14.3 billion AI investment, highlighted by its partnership with Scale AI, is reportedly facing internal challenges within the Superintelligence Lab (MSL). Friction stemming from the integration of new leadership and Meta's bureaucratic processes has led to high-profile departures. CEO Mark Zuckerberg's frustration with Llama 4's launch and the instability within the team further contribute to the turmoil.

title: Delhi-NCR rains: Thousands stuck in massive Gurgaon traffic snarl; watch video
content: Gurgaon faced severe traffic disruptions on Monday due to waterlogged roads and numerous vehicle breakdowns. Commuters experienced extensive delays, particularly on the Delhi-Jaipur Expressway and key intersections. The traffic police responded to around 200 distress calls, deploying personnel and cranes to manage the chaos.

title: Gold price prediction today: Rates hit new highs - where are they headed?
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold prices are surging, driven by expectations of Federal Reserve rate cuts and geopolitical uncertainties. Spot gold reached $3,475, while MCX October gold hit Rs 104,724. Analysts suggest buying on dips, anticipating a test of the all-time high at $3,500, with potential resistance at $3,650 and support at $3,450.

title: 'I tried to live as a man but couldn't': First-ever trans chess player who claimed WIM title
content: Yosha Iglesias, 37, made history as the first transgender chess player to earn the WIM title and win the French women‚Äôs championship. From battling depression, financial struggles, and online hate to embracing her identity in 2020, her journey reflects resilience.

title: Ahmedabad school murder: Bag checks expose hidden student world; blades, vapes, booze, condoms found
content: Following a fatal stabbing at an Ahmedabad school, surprise bag checks have revealed alarming items carried by students. Schools are finding lighters, vapes, and even alcohol, alongside concerning items like blades and contraceptives. Psychologists attribute this to peer pressure and exposure to adult content, while counselors highlight the influence of violent media and easy access to addictive substances at home.

title: 'They have caused an issue by bringing Gill into T20': Ex India star drops bombshell
content: Robin Uthappa suggests Shubman Gill's selection for the T20I Asia Cup and his vice-captaincy might be influenced by star power and marketing considerations, despite his recent strong Test performance. Uthappa believes that India has a history of backing superstars, and Gill's inclusion aligns with this trend, especially after a successful IPL 2025 season.

title: NASA‚Äôs first view of Earth from the Moon: A photo that changed how we see home
content: In 1966, NASA's Lunar Orbiter 1 captured the first image of Earth from the Moon. This photograph showed Earth as a fragile sphere. It changed humanity's perspective. The Lunar Orbiter program aimed to map the Moon for Apollo landings. Engineers captured the Earth image. The restored image revealed more details. This view sparked discussions about Earth's fragility.

title: Chhattisgarh rain fury: IAF airlifts man stranded for 12 hours in flooded Shabari river
content: A man was successfully rescued from the flood-swollen Shabari river near Nadigufa‚ÄìTelavarti after being stranded for over 12 hours. A joint operation by the Indian Air Force, Sukma district administration, police, and CRPF was launched after strong currents hampered initial rescue attempts. Drones pinpointed the man's location, leading to an airlift operation.

title: Mitchell Starc bids farewell to T20Is; eyes long Test and ODI journey ahead
content: Mitchell Starc has retired from T20 Internationals to prioritize Test and ODI cricket, finishing as Australia's second-highest T20I wicket-taker. He aims to stay fresh for upcoming Indian Test tour, Ashes, and 2027 ODI World Cup. Australia named their squad for the T20 series against New Zealand, with Ben Dwarshuis joining the pace attack.

title: Dwayne Johnson breaks down in tears as The Smashing Machine premiere earns standing ovation
content: Dwayne "The Rock" Johnson experienced an emotional premiere of "The Smashing Machine" at the Venice Film Festival, receiving a 15-minute standing ovation. Johnson, portraying UFC legend Mark Kerr, was moved to tears alongside co-star Emily Blunt, director Benny Safdie, and Kerr himself. The film's powerful reception has sparked Oscar buzz, with Johnson acknowledging the transformative nature of the project.

title: Dwayne Johnson weight loss: ‚ÄòSecret‚Äô behind massive transformation
content: Dwayne 'The Rock' Johnson surprised everyone at the Venice Film Festival with a noticeably leaner physique, sparking widespread reactions. This transformation, reportedly a 60-pound weight loss, is for his role as Mark Kerr in 'The Smashing Machine.' Johnson attributes the change to digestive health issues and a desire to authentically portray the character, dismissing Ozempic rumors.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens above 24,650; BSE Sensex up over 200 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in green on Tuesday following a strong rally the previous day. While Nifty50 was above 24,600, BSE Sensex was up over 200 points.

title: UP: Youth killed, body in Ganga; police cite relationship with friend‚Äôs sister
content: Kanpur police have solved the murder case of 22-year-old Rishikesh, whose torso was found in the Ganga. Four suspects are arrested, while four remain at large. Rishikesh was killed for having a relationship with the sister of prime suspect Pawan, who threatened him before the murder.

title: Massive landslide buries Darfur village: Over 1,000 killed; only one survivor found
content: A devastating landslide in Sudan's Darfur region has reportedly killed over 1,000 people in the village of Tarasin, according to the Sudan Liberation Movement/Army. With only one survivor found, the army-aligned governor of Darfur, Minni Minnawi, has appealed to international organizations for urgent assistance. The region remains largely inaccessible due to the ongoing civil war between the army and paramilitary Rapid Support Forces (RSF).

title: 'Fueling Russian war machine': Bessent's 'bad actors' jibe at India, China; dubs SCO meet 'performative'
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent voiced optimism about resolving trade tensions with India, saying, ‚Äútwo great countries will get this solved.‚Äù He dismissed the SCO summit as ‚Äúlargely performative,‚Äù despite PM Modi meeting Putin and Xi. Bessent criticized India‚Äôs Russian oil trade, while confirming Trump may impose more sanctions on Russia, stating, ‚Äúeverything‚Äôs on the table.‚Äù

title: Nestl√© fires CEO Laurent Freixe over ‚Äòromantic relationship‚Äô with subordinate
content: Nestl√© abruptly dismissed CEO Laurent Freixe after discovering an undisclosed romantic relationship with a subordinate, violating the company's code of conduct. Philipp Navratil, previously head of Nespresso, has been appointed as the new CEO, tasked with maintaining Nestl√©'s current strategy and improving efficiency. The decision follows an internal investigation and aims to uphold the company's values and governance.

title: 'War 2' box office collection day 19: Film sees drop on Monday; earns over Rs 235 crore
content: Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR's 'War 2' continues its box office run, earning Rs 235.1 crore in India by its 19th day, with Monday collections at Rs 0.60 crore. Rajinikanth‚Äôs 'Coolie', also in its third week, made Rs 1.10 crore on the same day, totaling Rs 280.20 crore.

title: Liverpool break bank for Isak; agrees to shell out ¬£130m to bring in Newcastle striker
content: Alexander Isak has moved to Liverpool from Newcastle United for a record fee. The Swedish striker's transfer is now the most expensive in British soccer history. Isak expressed his happiness to join Liverpool. Newcastle has signed Nick Woltemade and Yoane Wissa as replacements. Liverpool's acquisition of Isak is part of their summer spending.

title: Eurobasket 2025: Bosnia's Jusuf Nurkic fuels on-court rivalry with Greece's Giannis Antetokounmpo
content: As Eurobasket 2025 progresses, Jusuf Nurkic critiques Giannis Antetokounmpo's tactics, suggesting a strategy to limit his transition game and exploit perceived defensive weaknesses. This rivalry extends from their NBA matchups. Separately, Antetokounmpo faces scrutiny following a viral video depicting him slapping a teammate, sparking debate over the intent behind the gesture during an exhibition match.

title: Amid tariff tensions, US & India kick off largest-ever Army exercise in Alaska
content: Despite tariff tensions, India and the US commenced the 'Yudh Abhyas' Army exercise in Alaska. Planning is underway for the Malabar naval exercise with Quad nations off Guam. Defence cooperation remains strong, with ongoing deliveries of GE engines and a future deal for MQ-9B drones, highlighting the enduring strategic partnership.

title: PM Modi's China visit: SCO slams Pahalgam; India objects to BRI, which passes through POK
content: At the SCO summit, PM Modi condemned terrorism, highlighting the Pahalgam attack and urging members to avoid double standards. He emphasized security, connectivity respecting sovereignty, and opportunity through cooperation. India did not endorse China's BRI due to the CPEC. Modi advocated for UN reforms and proposed a Civilizational Dialogue Forum to strengthen ties, underscoring India's active role in the SCO.

title: Jordan Hudson: Partner of North Carolina coach Bill Belichick makes UNC debut
content: Bill Belichick's college football debut with UNC is shadowed by attention on his personal life, particularly his relationship with Jordan Hudson. Her presence, along with sightings of his former partner Linda Holliday, adds to the off-field narratives. Despite the buzz, the focus remains on Belichick's adaptation to college football's unique challenges.

title: Vetrimaaran to retire from production; reveals 'Bad Girl' will be his last film
content: Director Vetrimaaran announced the closure of his production house, Grass Root Film Company. This decision comes after the release of 'Bad Girl'. He cited pressures and challenges of film production as the reason. Vetrimaaran also discussed censorship issues faced by 'Manushi' and controversies surrounding 'Bad Girl'. He highlighted the financial strain on independent producers.

title: Aadhaar can't be standalone proof of citizenship, says SC
content: The Supreme Court has declined to direct the Election Commission to accept Aadhaar as sole proof of citizenship for Bihar voter list enrollment, emphasizing its legal limitations. Justices Surya Kant and Joymalya Bagchi reiterated that Aadhaar remains an identity document, not a citizenship proof, aligning with the Aadhaar Act and the Puttaswamy judgment.

title: T20I Tri-Series: Rashid Khan scripts history; Creates unforgettable record
content: Rashid Khan etched his name in T20I history, becoming the highest wicket-taker as Afghanistan defeated UAE by 38 runs. Khan's 3/21 restricted UAE to 150/8, surpassing Tim Southee's record. Afghanistan posted 188/4, fueled by Ibrahim Zadran's 63 and Sediqullah Atal's 54. Despite Muhammad Waseem's 67, UAE faltered. This victory marks Afghanistan's comeback in the tri-series after losing to Pakistan.

title: Moment marketing: Indian firms ride Trump's tariff wave; witty ads target US rivals
content: Fueled by Trump's tariffs, a 'swadeshi' wave sweeps India, with brands like Amul and Dabur championing local products through patriotic campaigns. While some experts see it as opportunism, others believe it resonates in smaller towns. Despite the sentiment, consumers prioritize value, questioning if nationalism alone can drive purchasing decisions as brands strategically tap into the 'vocal for local' trend.

title: Watch: Gambhir gives Kohli a brand new tag; surprises fans at DPL 2025 final
content: Gautam Gambhir was celebrated at the DPL 2025 final, where he playfully tagged cricketers with fitting descriptions. West Delhi Lions, led by Nitish Rana's unbeaten 79, clinched the title by defeating Central Delhi Kings. Rana's consistent performance throughout the playoffs and Gambhir's presence added excitement to the event.

title: Yamuna nears danger mark: Delhi braces for floods; CM says ‚Äòsituation under control‚Äô
content: Delhi is on high alert as the Yamuna River is expected to surpass the danger mark, potentially leading to floods. Evacuations are underway in low-lying areas like Yamuna Bazar and Mayur Vihar, with authorities setting up camps and providing food.

title: Rain, landslides batter Himachal, 5 more killed; monsoon toll over 300
content: Heavy rainfall in Himachal Pradesh triggered landslides, resulting in at least five fatalities and widespread disruption. Over 1,200 roads are blocked, including key highways, and power and water supplies are severely affected. The state has recorded its highest rainfall in August since 1949, exacerbating the challenges faced by residents and rescue efforts.

title: 'Param Sundari' box office collection: Movie sees a drop on Monday; crosses Rs 30cr mark
content: ‚ÄòParam Sundari,‚Äô starring Janhvi Kapoor and Sidharth Malhotra, had a strong opening weekend, grossing over Rs 26 crore. However, the rom-com experienced a significant drop on Monday, with collections falling to Rs 3.50 crore. Despite the dip, the film has surpassed Rs 30 crore in India and outperformed several of Janhvi's previous films, making it a notable success.

title: Clean Mumbai, free occupied areas by noon today, HC orders Jarange
content: The Bombay High Court has directed Maratha quota protesters, led by Jarange, to clear Mumbai's streets by noon, following petitions citing disruptions to city life and violations of fundamental rights. The court's special bench urged Jarange to ensure protesters vacate public spaces, allowing peaceful demonstrations at designated locations after fresh permissions are obtained.

title: WWE RAW Results: Kabuki Warriors stun Judgment Day duo; Dominik defends IC title vs Styles
content: Monday Night RAW after Clash in Paris saw Jey Uso confronting The Vision crew, leading to a tag team match where he partnered with LA Knight against Bron Breakker and Bronson Reed. The Kabuki Warriors defeated The Judgment Day, while Finn Balor triumphed over Dragon Lee.

title: Labour Day in US: Protests rock multiple cities; crowds take aim at Trump‚Äôs policies
content: Across the United States on Labor Day, protesters rallied against president Trump's policies in cities like New York, Chicago, and Washington DC. Demonstrations focused on issues such as immigrant rights, low wages, and concerns over potential National Guard deployments. The gatherings, organised by labour groups and activists, echoed previous protests against Trump's administration.

title: Former live-in partner burns woman to death on street in Bengaluru
content: In a shocking incident in Bengaluru, Vanajakshi was burned alive by her former live-in partner, Vittal, due to jealousy over her relationships. The victim succumbed to her injuries in the hospital, leaving behind a young son. In a separate incident, a man was arrested for allegedly abetting his wife's suicide, following accusations of dowry harassment and infidelity.

title: "2 Hours Rain, 20 Km Jam": Gurugram Choked Again, Opposition Targets BJP
content: The Nayab Singh Saini-led BJP government in Haryana is taking fire due to waterlogging and kilometres-long traffic jams last evening. Opposition leaders have slammed the ruling BJP, which has been in power in Haryana for over a decade now

title: "Oil Was Black Gold, Chips Are Digital Diamonds": PM Modi On Semiconductors
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, on Tuesday, while addressing the Semicon India 2025 event, said that oil was "black gold" but semiconductor chips are a "digital diamond".

title: Ukrainian Drone Attack Forces Hundreds To Evacuate Homes In Russian City
content: More than 300 people were evacuated from their apartments overnight following a Ukrainian drone attack on the capital of the Rostov region, the acting governor said on Tuesday.

title: Mumbai Cops Arrest 60-Year-Old Banana Vendor For Smuggling Drugs Worth Rs 35 Lakh
content: Mumbai Police have arrested a 60-year-old man for peddling MD drugs while posing as a banana seller in Bandra.

title: Tesla Gets Around 600 Orders Since India Launch: Report
content: Tesla has received orders for just over 600 cars since launching sales in India in mid-July, a number that has fallen short of the company's own expectations, Bloomberg News reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the matter.

title: 1 Killed, 3 Injured After 2 Planes Collide Midair At Colorado Airport
content: One person was killed and three were injured when two small planes collided midair as they tried to land at an airport in northeastern Colorado, authorities said.

title: "Trump Threw Away India Ties For Family's Pakistan Deals": Ex-US Official
content: Former US National Security Advisor (NSA) Jake Sullivan has accused President Donald Trump of jeopardising America's ties with India to favour his family's business deals in Pakistan.

title: Sri Lanka President Visits Katchatheevu Island, Vows To Protect Territory
content: Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Dissanayake visited Katchatheevu on Monday, becoming the first Lankan head of state to visit the island.

title: Child Kidnapping Racket Busted In Hyderabad, 6 Rescued
content: A child kidnapping gang operating for five years in Hyderabad was busted on Monday, with the police rescuing six children and arresting five people involved in the racket.

title: Weather Office Issues Red Alert For Uttarakhand, Schools Shut In 10 Districts
content: Uttarakhand continues to reel under the impact of incessant rainfall as the India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued red and orange alerts across the state for Tuesday.

title: China Showing Off Its Weaponry In A Tightly Controlled Military Parade
content: China's missiles, fighter jets and other military hardware  some on public view for the first time  are being displayed in a major parade Wednesday in the nation's capital.

title: Xi And Putin Reaffirm 'Old Friend' Ties In The Face Of US Challenges
content: Chinese leader Xi Jinping welcomed Russian President Vladimir Putin as an "old friend" as the two began a series of meetings Tuesday at a time when their countries face both overlapping and differing challenges from the United States.

title: 1,000-Crore Gold Export Fraud At Chennai Airport, 5 Customs Officials Named
content: The Central Bureau of Investigation has registered a First Information Report in connection with a massive gold export fraud at Chennai Airport Cargo.

title: Day After Rahul Gandhi's Hydrogen Bomb Threat, BJP's Big Pawan Khera Charge
content: A day after senior Congress leader Rahul Gandhi warned that his party is preparing to detonate a "hydrogen bomb" of revelations as part of 'vote chori' charge, BJP has hit back by alleging that Congress leader Pawan Khera holds two active voter cards

title: Adani International School Student Creates AI Tool To Aid Color-Blind Students
content: Adani International School student Aahan Ritesh Prajapati, who was born with red and green colour blindness, has pioneered a machine-learning model capable of modifying textbook diagrams and maps for colour-blind students.

title: The Slow Train From North Korea: How Kim Jong Un Travels To China
content: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un left Pyongyang by train on Monday on his way to Beijing, Yonhap news agency reported, relying on a slow but specialised form of transport that the reclusive country's leaders have used for decades.

title: Floodwater Enters Delhi Homes As Yamuna Crosses Danger Mark
content: Floodwater entered houses in Delhi-NCR as the water level of the Yamuna river crossed the danger mark after heavy overnight rainfall. The rising water levels have also caused significant traffic congestion, particularly at the Delhi-Gurugram border.

title: Maratha Quota Activist Manoj Jarange Gets Notice, Cops Ask Protesters To Vacate Azad Maidan
content: Mumbai Police on Tuesday issued a notice to activist Manoj Jarange and his team, asking them to vacate Azad Maidan at the earliest, as his hunger strike over the Maratha quota demand entered its fifth day, officials said.

title: In Rare Foreign Visit, North Korea's Kim Uses Bulletproof Train To Enter China
content: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un entered China on Tuesday aboard a private train to attend a military parade in Beijing, a rare overseas visit that will underscore his ties with both President Xi Jinping and Russian leader Vladimir Putin.

title: China-Russia Ties Are At "Unprecedented Level": Putin Tells Xi Jinping
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin told his Chinese counterpart on Tuesday that their countries' ties were at an "unprecedented level" during talks in Beijing ahead of a massive military parade.

title: Bolts' Harris cleared for contact, expects to play
content: new: "it's probably my fifth day at practice," he says . new: he expects to play in the Chargers' season opener against the Kansas City Chiefs . he missed all of training camp because of an eye injury he sustained in a fireworks mishap . "there's a possibility," says a coach .

title: 'No days off': Inside the pillars of Patriots' Mike Vrabel's hands-on coaching style
content: a former linebacker who became a head coach emerged with a bloody cut on his cheek . he was hired as the 16th head coach in the Patriots history in january . the former nfl player was tangled up with an defender on the ground during a practice .

title: Only in college football: Week 1's best non-statistical superlatives
content: the legendary Lee Corso picks Ohio State to win in his final "College GameDay" opening weekend always delivers a little bit of everything that makes fans say, "Only in college football" a mascot lost its head (literally) and a storybook tribute was delivered .

title: Week 1 takeaways: What happened to Arch Manning? Is Utah the Big 12 team to beat?
content: arch Manning showed that there's room to improve when it comes to his decision-making, accuracy and timing . Utah 's new-look offense showed that it might be the team to beat in a wide-open Big 12 title race . our college football experts break down key takeaways from Week 1 performances .

title: Transfer deadline day recap: Gu√©hi deal collapses
content: the transfer window has closed and it's been a big one . the premier league broke its ¬£2.36 billion single-window record from 2023 . champions Liverpool alone were responsible for around ¬£450m of that, including around ¬£130m on Alexander Isak .

title: College football Power Rankings: First impressions of each Top 25 team
content: first impressions can be deceiving -- shoutout to Kenny Trill and a magical night in 2014 -- but they also provide much-yearned-for context to the power rankings . some could be a harbinger for big things ahead, like Florida State steamrolling Alabama following a 2-10 season in 2024 .
